title.value: Toward Metrics for Differentiating Out-of-Distribution Sets
title.justification: This is the official title of the paper as given in the provided text.
title.quote: Toward Metrics for Differentiating Out-of-Distribution Sets

extractions.description: The paper explores methods for differentiating between out-of-distribution (OOD) sets to select the most effective one for training calibrated convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for OOD detection. The authors propose computationally efficient metrics based on generalization errors of augmented-CNNs (A-CNNs) and verify their effectiveness empirically.

type.justification: The paper is empirical as it proposes methods and evaluates them through a series of experiments on image and audio classification tasks.
type.quote: We conduct a series of experiments on several classification tasks including two image benchmarks, namely CIFAR-10 and SVHN, and one audio benchmark, namely Urban-Sound [28].

name.justification: The research focuses on improving convolutional neural networks for out-of-distribution detection, a prominent topic in machine learning.
name.quote: Vanilla CNNs, as uncalibrated classifiers, suffer from classifying out-of-distribution (OOD) samples nearly as confidently as in-distribution samples.

name.justification: The paper involves deep learning models, specifically Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), for OOD detection and introduces augmented and calibrated CNNs.
name.quote: To tackle this challenge, some recent works have demonstrated the gains of leveraging available OOD sets for training end-to-end calibrated CNNs.
